intro: Gonolobus undulatus, commonly known as the undulating goonloob, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive, undulating leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow or greenish in color. It is often found in moist, shaded areas and can grow up to several meters in height. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are adapted for dispersal by wind or animals.
